You are a patient: You are 58 years old and your biological gender is male.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:

- Shortness of breath and feeling very lightheaded
- Coughing up blood intermittently

These symptoms came into fruition suddenly yesterday afternoon, while you were at work. You’ve noticed a sharp pain in your chest that radiates to your back, and it’s been getting worse quickly. You’ve been feeling increasingly faint and worried because you’ve also started coughing up small amounts of blood. You have a history of high blood pressure and smoking, and your father had an aneurysm in his brain.

My wife was worried, and she convinced me to come because I just feel worse and I’m scared about what this might be.
